titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Final report, study of a robotic military vehicle evaluation, demonstration, and training site at Camp Grayling, Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Final report, study of a robotic military vehicle evaluation, demonstration, and training site at Camp Grayling, Michigan

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: The Michigan Automated Vehicle Research Consortium was established in 1985 by Teledyne Continental Motors, Lear Sigler, KMS Fusion, and Wayne State University. It was dissolved in 1990.
archdesc.scopecontent: Report of a study relating to the possibility of developing a robotic military vehicle test site at Camp Grayling, Michigan.
